shows.title: Land of the Lost / Beekeeping
shows.first_half: Actor/producer Wesley Eure was featured in the legendary hit TV shows "Land of the Lost" and "Days of Our Lives." He joins Connie Willis (info) to discuss his film and TV projects, which included interacting with the "Sleestak" aliens on "Land of the Lost."  In the second half, beekeeper Charlie Agar, better known as Charlie Bee, will delve into the lives of bees, beekeeping, and the importance of pollinator conservation.
shows.second_half: 6-10pm PT: Art Bell - Somewhere in Time returns to  2/13/02 when Michael C. Luckman, director of the NY Center for ET Research, talked about UFOs and anomalies.

shows.title: Pain Medication Controversy / Gray Barker & UFOs
shows.first_half: First Half: ER physician Dr. Mark Ibsen, with over 30 years of experience and six years in urgent care, joins George Knapp to discuss his 19-year legal battle with the Montana Board of Medicine over prescribing opioids for pain patients in a hostile regulatory climate.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Author and historian Gabriel Mckee will delve into the life and career of Gray Barker (1925-1984), a foundational UFO author and publisher. Barker started one of the earliest flying saucer zines, The Saucerian, and operated Saucerian Books, a publishing house that put out some of the strangest books on the paranormal of the era.

shows.title: AI & Pole Shifts / Chemtrails & Geoengineering
shows.first_half: First Half: Professor James McCanney will discuss his belief that AI will fail and what the ramifications to the public will be. He'll also delve into the differences between magnetic and physical pole shifts, and the importance of physical pole shifts in understanding the true history of humanity and the Earth.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Researcher, writer, and activist Peter A. Kirby will share his work on chemtrails, global warming, and geoengineering, as well as his contention that our skies are being polluted and that officials are ignoring the problem.

shows.title: Economy Update / Spooky Stories
shows.first_half: First Half: Economist and financial expert Harry Dent will be talking about the economy, the health of our individual finances, and how we can tune up our money. He'll also present his argument that the government has been delaying a deep downturn after the greatest bubble in history.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Author and podcaster Jim Harold’s show "The Paranormal Podcast" is one of the longest-running podcasts in its genre. He'll bring us his brand of spooky stories from his Campfire podcast and his 20 years of paranormal podcasting.

shows.title: The Food Chain / Shroud of Turin
shows.first_half: First Half: Author and radio host Michael Olson will discuss the food chain, what we are eating, why we all must get closer to the source of our food, and how we can close the distance.
shows.second_half: Second Half: Documentary filmmaker and author L. A. Marzulli brings us his research on the Shroud of Turin, which may be the most studied artifact in the world. He believes that the nail prints in the lower palms, the wound in the side, as well as a crown of thorns, are indicative that it is indeed an authentic image of the crucified body of Jesus.

shows.title: Rod Serling & Twilight Zone / Witchcraft & Spells
shows.guests: Marc Zicree, Cheryll Jones, Patti Negri
shows.first_half: First Half: Marc Scott Zicree is the author of the best-selling "Twilight Zone Companion" book. As we are upon the June 28th 50th anniversary of the death of Rod Serling, Marc will discuss and honor Serling and the 156 episodes of the classic Twilight Zone television program.
shows.second_half: Second Half: C2C's investigative reporter Cheryll Jones shares her interview with Patti Negri, psychic medium and "Good Witch," on spirit communication, witchcraft rituals, and spells.

shows.title: Facets of Perception / Open Lines
shows.first_half: Author and artist Sonja Grace joins guest host Ryan Wrecker (email) for a discussion on the importance of how we perceive reality and the many different facets of perception. According to Grace, humanity can be seen as a medicine wheel, in that we perceive the same thing from many different perspectives. Followed by Open Lines in the latter half. Give Ryan a call and discuss whatever is on your mind!
